column13: STEPS TAKEN TO ARRIVE AT THE ABOVE REGIONAL PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS TABLE

column12: From the above Regional Performance Analysis Table, the following can be inferred:
column13: 1. Duplicaes entries were removed through by clicking on Data and remove duplicate entries

column12: 1. Southern region has the highest number  of  purchases (295  units) with sales value of $8,049 which is 30.49% of the total  sales value
column13: 2. Rows where price per units  contains "inf" were removed through conditional formatting after highlihting he table.

column12: 2. Northern region has the lowest number  of  purchases (105 units) with sales value of $8,049 which is  9.09% of the total  sales value
column13: 3. THE TOTAL SALES VALUE COLUMN was gotten by  multiplying each cells in the Quantity column by  the cells in the price per unit column.

column12: 3. Asgard and  Eastern region are closely matched in terms of number of purchses and total sales values which  stands at  (155 and 190 units sold with total sales values  of $ 4,499 and $4,400  which  is 17.04 and 16.67 % of  the total sales value respectively.
column13: 4. New table was  created  with the following headings: ("REGION", "TOTAL QUANTITY SOLD", TOTAL SALES VALUE", and "TOTAL SALES VALUE PERCENTAGE"

column12: 4. An unidentified region has 30 units of goods bought, with sales value of $1,100.10  which is 4.17% of the total  sales value.
column13: 5. Total quantity sold by each region was gotten by filtering the region column and sorting alphabetically while summing up total sales  per region.
6.  Total sales values for each region was gotten by  summing up each each region's total sales value after filtering and sorting the region section.
7.  Each Regional total sales  percentage was gotten using the sum if function  (i.e =SUMIF(L4:L9,L4,N4:N10)/$N$10)
